name: Montre
tagline: A timed regular expression matcher over timed symbolic behaviors
body:
## Use for
* Pattern search/extraction over timed behaviors (analog signals, execution traces, music, etc.)
* Runtime monitoring/verification of real-time systems
* Feature extraction and dimensionality reduction before temporal pattern mining

## Get Started
First install Pure 0.64 and dependencies. For more details please refer to the original documents:
https://bitbucket.org/purelang/pure-lang/wiki/GettingStarted
```sh
wget https://bitbucket.org/purelang/pure-lang/downloads/pure-0.64.tar.gz
tar xfvz pure-0.64.tar.gz
cd pure-0.64
./configure --enable-release
make
make check
sudo make install
```
Then install Montre as follows:

```sh
git clone https://github.com/doganulus/montre
cd montre
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=./src/libmontre/
make
sudo make install
```

## Tutorial
We have used Montre to find all sprints performed by a player in a real soccer match. See the tutorial [Finding Sprints](https://github.com/doganulus/montre/blob/master/demo/finding-sprints.ipynb).

## About
Montre has been developed by [Dogan Ulus](http://doganulus.com) at Verimag/Universite Grenoble Alpes as a part of his (ongoing) PhD thesis.

## Acknowledgments
The development of Montre, in particular the theory behind, has benefited from the suggestions and contributions from Thomas Ferrere, Eugene Asarin, Oded Maler, Dejan Nickovic and Marius Bozga.
